channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Path misused by unlawful users problem, 7th October
item.description:
Reporting:path_misused_by_unlawful_users Vehicles driving down the footpath. Lack of signage and a post to stop cars from driving down the footpath. Residents are concerned about unlawful access to the fields running alongside the footpath. The footpath is used by Dogwalker’s, people and children walking to school and mobility scooters.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Badly smashed/wobbly paving stones in a precarious position, 6th October
item.description:
To the right of the Queens Hotel, at the top of the Promenade close to the junction with Montpellier Walk, there are some very badly damaged paving stones on a corner which will be very busy with footfall over the next 10 days (Literature Festival). One paving slab bounces up and down, another is completely smashed. The look like they"ve been damaged by traffic but due to street/road obstacles, this should be impossible

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Imperial Square, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: The sign is illegible problem, 6th October
item.description:
Non-Illuminated bollards and signs PostSustained other damage Post Hi. There isn't an appropriate category, but as you can see this post (unlike the others in All Saints Villas Road) hasn't been cut off above the sign, so is a completely different height. In addition, it's in the middle of the pavement, blocking the way, whereas the other signs are next to walls. Please rectify these mistakes.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose/rattling cover/ironwork problem, 6th October
item.description:
There are several noisy covers on the A435, customer can hear these at night and they are a disturbance. there are 2 near the roundabout by The Cloisters and another further south.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The sign is illegible problem, 6th October
item.description:
FMS 04/10/2023 - Barriers and sandbags that have been on Shakespeare Road for months, Barriers and sandbags that have been on Shakespeare Road for months. Can someone investigate please and get them taken away

item.title: Obstruction caused by wall/building problem, 6th October
item.description:
I was walking last week on the footpath crossing the A40( which is really very dangerous and the speed should be adjusted to 60 or even better to 50mph-but that’s not why I am writing). At the crossing to the Kilham Lane into Shipton Oliffe the farmer blocked off the last bit of public footpath with an electric fence and has his sheep in the field. There was no gate I could open to walk on the footpath. He should leave space for walkers.
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24, Howell Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham

item.title: General road marking and stud issues problem, 6th October
item.description:
The road was surfaced and road markings applied yesterday. The road markings have been applied so thin that the tarmac can be seen below. The thickness of material used is not in accordance with the British standard. This applies to all road markings not limited to the double yellow lines. The poor application will impact the longevity of the road markings.
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road marking and stud issues

item.description:
The road was surfaced and road markings applied today. The road markings have been applied so thin that the tarmac can be seen below. The thickness of material used is not in accordance with the British standard. This applies to all road markings not limited to the double yellow lines. The poor application will impact the longevity of the road markings.

item.title: Vehicle leaking Diesel/oil, 5th October
item.description:
Vehicle that is untaxed and used daily is leaking excessive amounts of oil/diesel onto the road. Making it hazardous for animals and children that play in the area. It is used regularly in the Cheltenham area by GrassScape company in Cheltenham "www.GrassScape.co.uk. Vehicle is outside the St Pauls Hub side of the walk, in the area of numbers 15,16 St Pauls Walk. Vehicle Reg: DK08 BGV, Mitsubishi Fuso supposedly in White but is painted Grey.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 20, St Paul's Walk, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The sign is illegible problem, 5th October
item.description:
signage originally stated traffic calming (tractor on triangle sign) and now there is only the pole that held the sign. no sign is now causing a situation of vehicles dangerously stopping to try and locate turning. breaking hard.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles problem, 5th October
item.description:
Temporary traffic lights Timings are incorrect Hi, This morning 5th Oct at roughly 05:45 heading North the lights turned green as I approached them on my pedal bike, I cycled as fast as I could, but a cyclist came over the bridge in the other direction (I don't know if they jumped red or not) but when I came over the bridge and the other lights came into view they had already turned green. This is extremely dangerous - there's no line-of-sight over the humped bridge and there was nowhere near enough time for me to cycle through before the lights changed - a motor vehicle could have come over in the other direction and gone straight into me. These lights MUST allow enough time for a cyclist.
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles

item.title: General road marking and stud issues problem, 5th October
item.description:
Drivers constantly park on the white road markings on the bend and the yellow zigzags outside of the school. Is there a way to make the road markings more prominent and perhaps some road signs?
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road marking and stud issues
